title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.16.22 | 29-01-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyana Timiraandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chakshurunmeelitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras, invoking blessings and setting the spiritual tone.

segments.key_quote: The so-called administrators are now bewildered by the influence of this age of Kali and thus they have put all state affairs into disorder.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the 22nd verse of the 16th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, discussing the degraded condition of Kali Yuga and the bewilderment of administrators.

segments.key_quote: Adharma Bandhu Kali is described as Adharma Bandhu friend of irreligion so irreligion becomes prominent.
segments.summary: This segment elaborates on the influence of Kali Yuga, highlighting the prominence of irreligion and the resulting disorder in state affairs due to irreligious administrators.

segments.key_quote: Civilized society means there should be some regulation otherwise people who are unregulated they simply perform these activities anywhere and everywhere without any restriction.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the importance of rules and regulations in a civilized society, contrasting it with the unregulated behavior prevalent in Kali Yuga, comparing human and animal needs.

segments.key_quote: The influence of the age of Kali is bewildering people that means they are overwhelmed by the prospect of becoming irreligious not following the the rules and regulations given in the scriptures.
segments.summary: This segment focuses on the code of conduct for human beings, the bewildering influence of Kali Yuga, and the resulting moral decline as people disregard scriptural rules and regulations.

segments.key_quote: Even in India where the very culture is still prominent still there are people who are in a small number a minority of the section of the human population here are not so much strict in following the rules.
segments.summary: The speaker laments the gradual social decline, even in India, and emphasizes the challenges faced by parents in raising children amidst bad influences in the age of Kali.

segments.key_quote: Even though the house household atmosphere may be good because parents are very cultured they their upbringing is very good and the child is very small but once the child starts going to school it is exposed to so many bad things outside the house.
segments.summary: The speaker narrates the story of Ajamila, illustrating how a single instance of bad association can lead to moral corruption, even for someone from a cultured background.

segments.key_quote: By the influence of the age of kali everywhere politically socially religiously everything is topsy-turvy therefore for the same person it is all regrettable it's a very serious problem for sober people.
segments.summary: The lecture concludes by reiterating the pervasive influence of Kali Yuga, leading to social problems and challenges, particularly for those trying to maintain a cultured upbringing.
